an10.4:4.1: There Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants …
an10.4:4.2: “Reverends, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.4:4.3: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.4:4.4: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:4.5: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an10.4:4.6: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an10.4:4.9: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.4:4.10: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.4:4.11: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:5.1: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.4:5.2: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.4:5.3: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.4:5.4: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an10.4:5.5: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an10.4:5.8: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.4:5.9: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.4:5.10: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
